result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Defendant Kenneth J Weber in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advises defendant is ready to proceed with Plea and Sentencing today.  State recited offer on record.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 3, 4 and 5 are dismissed and read-in.  State and Defense gave their sentencing recommendations.  

**COUNT 1**

Court orders the following:	
Costs/Fine:  $3394.50
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid within 30 days or Civil Judgment to be entered for non-payment.

*****************************************************************************

**COUNT 2**

Court orders the following:	
Costs/Fine:  $2500.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid within 30 days or Civil Judgment to be entered for non-payment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Kenneth J Weber in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Bucher requets to waive preliminary hearing. 
Court conducts colloquy with defendant. 
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information
Defense accepts receipt of information.
  Waive reading of Information.
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Court to set new hearing date once new Judge is assgined.

filed by Atty Bucher.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 6/16/2022 - Approved.**
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed Atty Paul Bucher
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

08:23 AM Defendant Kenneth J Weber in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
